decks.notes: Utilizing a combination of disruptive spells and efficient creatures, the deck aims to control the game's tempo by disrupting the opponent's strategy while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Murktide Regent. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to generate card advantage and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to further disrupt the opponent's plans. By efficiently managing resources and disrupting the opponent's game plan, the deck can quickly close out games before the opponent can mount a defense.

This deck focuses on tempo and disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Baleful Strix and Murktide Regent. Using disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Hymn to Tourach, the deck aims to control the board and keep the opponent on the back foot. With a mix of removal, card draw, and counterspells, the deck is able to adapt to various situations and maintain a strong presence on the battlefield. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's resources while maintaining a consistent tempo and applying pressure to close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage and maintaining board control. The inclusion of Leyline Binding and Quantum Riddler adds additional ways to control the opponent's actions, while cards like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide card draw and incremental advantage. The deck's mana base is designed to support its multicolor requirements, allowing it to consistently cast its spells and maintain its control over the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing a mix of aggressive creatures and disruption spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. It includes powerful creatures like Uro and Kaito, alongside disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will. The mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the spells and creatures, with Wasteland providing additional disruption. Overall, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent while disrupting their strategy, allowing the player to control the game and secure a win.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan, using cards like Thoughtseize and Daze, while also applying pressure with efficient threats like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares. The deck utilizes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Snuff Out, as well as cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency. The mana denial strategy with Wasteland and disruption with cards like Force of Will are crucial to the deck's success. The deck aims to control the game and tempo, while closing out games quickly with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while quickly deploying threats to control the tempo of the game. With a mix of counterspells, discard spells, and efficient creatures, it aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while protecting its own board presence. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's resources with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, while utilizing powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to close out the game quickly. By efficiently balancing disruption and aggression, the deck aims to outpace and overwhelm the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using lands like Eye of Ugin and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. Chalice of the Void helps disrupt opponents' strategies, while Cavern of Souls ensures your Eldrazi spells can't be countered. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive Eldrazi creatures and disrupt their game plan with cards like Wasteland and Kozilek's Command. It's all about efficient mana ramp and big, impactful plays to quickly close out the game.

This deck aims to control the game through a combination of land manipulation and disruption effects. By utilizing cards like Thespian's Stage, Life from the Loam, and Dark Depths, the deck can generate powerful threats while denying opponents of their resources with Wasteland and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale. The goal is to outvalue the opponent by utilizing lands as a resource and overwhelming them with efficient land-based threats. Additionally, the deck includes various toolbox lands and disruption spells to deal with a variety of threats and strategies.

The deck focuses on assembling the Cephalid Breakfast combo to quickly mill your library, then using powerful enablers like Dread Return and Thassa's Oracle to win the game instantly. It utilizes cards like Cephalid Illusionist, Narcomoeba, and Nomads en-Kor to set up the combo efficiently, with support from counterspells like Force of Will and disruption like Cabal Therapy. The deck also includes some utility cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Stoneforge Mystic to provide additional value and protection. Overall, the deck aims to win through a powerful and fast combo while controlling the game with versatile spells.

This deck focuses on using lands as a resource to control the game, with the combination of Thespian's Stage and Dark Depths as a win condition. It includes various utility lands like Maze of Ith and Karakas to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while also utilizing cards like Crop Rotation and Life from the Loam to ensure consistent land drops and graveyard recursion. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with powerful land synergies and disrupt their game plan with cards like Wasteland and Pithing Needle.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize Coveted Jewel and other powerful artifacts to create a combo that generates advantage and allows for alternate win conditions. The deck aims to ramp up quickly, protect key pieces with counterspells like Force of Will, and potentially drop game-winning threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn through cards like Show and Tell. It also includes cards like Transmute Artifact and Copy Artifact to search for and duplicate key pieces, while also using cards like Grim Monolith and Paradox Engine to generate mana efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to use Show and Tell to cheat out powerful creatures or enchantments such as Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Omniscience onto the battlefield for free. It also utilizes cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its own combo pieces. Additionally, the deck includes card draw and manipulation spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency and find key pieces quickly. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disruption and card advantage to control the game. Utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while drawing into powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares. By combining removal spells like Fatal Push and Orcish Bowmasters with card selection tools like Ponder and Brainstorm, the deck is able to maintain control of the board and outvalue the opponent in the late game.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to put pressure on the opponent early in the game by playing aggressively-costed Eldrazi creatures and disrupting their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Wastescape Battlemage. The deck aims to take advantage of powerful cards such as Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher to maintain tempo and control the board. By using lands like Ancient Tomb and Cavern of Souls to accelerate its mana base, this deck is able to deploy threats quickly and overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

The deck revolves around cheating powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand into play by using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. It also utilizes cards like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Omniscience to generate advantage and overwhelm opponents. The deck is designed to quickly set up its game-winning combo and disrupt opponents with counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm. By efficiently manipulating the board and effectively deploying its threats, the deck aims to win the game in a timely fashion.

The main concept of this deck revolves around utilizing efficient tempo plays and disruption to control the game while applying pressure with aggressive threats. By combining disruptive cards like Thoughtseize, Daze, and Force of Will with powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly closing out the game. The inclusion of card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder helps maintain card advantage and consistency, while cards like Fatal Push and Orcish Bowmasters provide additional removal options to maintain control of the board.
